title: Accessibility problems
description: I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas before it starts working (e.g., the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame). When I launch the Help view on Win2K, the tab key does not actually do anything. We should be starting the Help view in a way that can be immediately navigated via the keyboard.
OB: When I launch the Help view on Win2K, the tab key does not actually do anything. I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas before it starts working (e.g., the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame).
EB: The Help view should be launched in a way that can be immediately navigated via the keyboard, without the need to click on any 'live' areas.
SR:
1. Launch the Help view on Win2K.
2. Observe that the tab key does not do anything.
3. Click on one of the 'live' areas such as the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame.
4. Observe that the Help view starts working correctly.
5. Ideally, the Help view should be launched directly and immediately navigable via the keyboard without the need to click on any 'live' areas.
